intro: Dillwynia uncinata, commonly known as the slender dillwynia, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Dillwynia uncinata produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is a perennial shrub that is relatively drought-tolerant and has small, narrow leaves.
